intro: Scorzonera alborzensis, commonly known as the white scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Compositae and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, oblong tubers that are sometimes used in traditional medicine. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Scorzonera alborzensis is a rare species, with limited distribution and specific ecological requirements.
